movies.title: L'ange gardien de Noël
movies.plot: Although she is still upset from a recent breakup, Corrine (Gilsig) happily prepares for her favorite holiday: Christmas! A gifted musician, Corrine auditions for a solo in a community Christmas concert and plays Christmas carols on the piano to patrons of the music store where she works with childhood friend Dave (Abbey). Her holiday season gets an unexpected dose of romance, when Harold (Di Zio), a mysterious new coworker, tries to form a love connection between Corrine and Dave. With Harold's help, Corrine begins to view Dave in a new light, though she questions Harold's intense interest in her love life. Unbeknownst to Corrine, Harold is on a Christmas Eve deadline from a higher power to fulfill this holiday fairytale! As the clock ticks down to Harold's fairytale mission deadline, Corrine must decide if she will open up to Christmas love.
movies.simplePlot: Three suitors pursue a hopeless romantic after she makes a wish to find true love before Christmas

biography.bio: Jessalyn Gilsig has an extensive list of theater credits to her name. A graduate of McGill University in Montreal, Canada, Gilsig received her theatrical training at the American Repertory Theatre's Institute for Advanced Theatre Training at Harvard University. Among the American Repertory Theatre projects in which she appeared are "The Cherry Orchard," "Henry V," "The Oresteia," "Tartuffe" and "The Tempest." She also appeared in the Alliance Theatre production of "The Last Night of Ballyhoo," and in numerous other live productions and television commercials.
biography.name: Jessalyn Gilsig

biography.bio: Sergio Di Zio was born in Toronto, Canada. Detective Patrick Finnegan; Rogue (2015-), Michelangelo "Spike" Scarlatti; Flashpoint (2008-2012) . Miss Sloane (2017), Rupture (2016), The Walk (2015), Flash of Genius(2008) The Lookout (2007). Awards: 2011 Gemini for Best performance by an Actor in A featured Supporting Role for Flashpoint and 2015 Dora Mavor Moore Award; Best Male Performance- Independent Theatre Division; Stephen Adly Guergis' "The Motherfucker With The Hat.", Toronto premiere.
biography.name: Sergio Di Zio

biography.bio: Graham Abbey is known for his work on The Border (2008), Take This Waltz (2011) and Defendor: héros ou zéro (2009).
biography.name: Graham Abbey

biography.bio: Roger Doche is an actor and producer, known for Manson (2009), L'ange gardien de Noël (2014) and Speak Now (2015).
biography.name: Roger Doche

biography.bio: Richard Waugh was born the youngest of seven in London, Ontario, Canada. At the age of fifteen, he founded a children's theatre company in London's Storybook Gardens that lasted several years past his directorship. Part way through training at Ryerson theatre school in Toronto, he was chosen to join the Shaw Festival Theatre Company, where he stayed for six seasons. Currently he is considered one of the top voice actors in Canadian advertising while maintaining his television, film and stage careers.
biography.name: Richard Waugh

biography.bio: Trained in classical theatre and improv, Samantha has played roles from Shakespeare to Morris Panych, working in major Canadian repertory theatres, as well as dozens of roles for feature films and prime time TV. In 2015, Samantha had her Toronto International Film Festival debut with The Rainbow Kid, a Canadian made indie gem. You can see Samantha in the Toronto based romantic comedy Dirty Singles, available on iTunes and in the critically acclaimed Starz television series, The Girlfriend Experience.
biography.name: Samantha Espie

biography.bio: Lindsay is a professional actor, director, improviser, trainer and an alumnus of world renowned sketch comedy theatre The Second City. Lindsay and her partner Lee Smart provide creative services for the entertainment industry in Toronto, Canada. Lindsay began her career by training at The National Theatre School of Canada, graduating in 1981. She has been seen and heard in many roles on stage and in film, television, animation, radio and TV commercials. Some selected credits include The Prizewinner of Defiance Ohio, Ginger Snaps, Comfort & Joy, Coast to Coast, Tommy Boy, Three to Tango, The Wrong Guy, Brain Candy, & Mr. Headmistress. Lindsay is the founder, director of The Tim Sims Encouragement Fund, (a charitable organization administered by the Ontario Arts Foundation) which has supported up and coming comedic performers with an annual cash prize of recognition since 1996. She is the executive producer of Cream of Comedy, the nationally broadcast award show for the TSEF on The Comedy Network since 1998. Lindsay began teaching improvisation in 1989, and continues to work as a corporate trainer specializing in the application of improvisational techniques to improve business success. She also provides business presentation coaching services and training with PitchCraft.
biography.name: Lindsay Leese

biography.bio: Chris Chinchilla is an actor, known for Dead Stop (1995), Le costume du Père Noël (2010) and Breakout (1998).
biography.name: Chris Chinchilla

biography.bio: Laura Nordin is an actress and producer, known for Talking Dead (2008), Super Powers (2006) and The Package (2008).
biography.name: Laura Nordin
